DOC.brief_title: A Pilot Study Assess Effects Doxazosin Polysomnography PTSD
DOC.detailed_description: This pilot study assess effect doxazosin objective measure sleep PTSD subject use home ambulatory polysomnography . Twenty ( 20 ) men woman chronic PTSD enrol San Francisco Veterans Affairs Medical Center . After initial screening , subject complete 1 week baseline assessment include 2 night home ambulatory polysomnography . They participate 2-week flexible-dose titration doxazosin base clinical response adverse effect follow 6 week steady dose treatment end 2 night home polysomnography . Subjective rater-based assessment conduct baseline set interval end treatment . Wrist actigraphy measurement also make baseline end treatment economical , fairly valid unobtrusive measure sleep duration . We hypothesize doxazosin associate increase total sleep time ( TST ) decrease wake time sleep onset ( WASO ) . We hypothesize doxazosin also associate clinical gain respect nightmare , subjective sleep quality , non-sleep PTSD symptom , depression symptom , quality life .
